issue.title: Admin's page: empty messages not showing up
issue.body:
If there are 1 or more unvetted props the empty message will not appear to a specific list.

Case 1:
- Make sure there are no unvetted props on admin's list. 
- Create a proposal and go to admins screen.
- The created proposal should be under "only unreviewed"
- Select the radio "only censored": the list will be empty and no message will appear
- Go back to "only unreviewed", approve the proposal: the list will be empty and no message will appear


Case 2:
- Make sure there are no unvetted props on admin's list. 
- Create a proposal and go to admins screen.
- The created proposal should be under "only unreviewed"
- Spam the proposal: the list will be empty and no message will appear


Case 1 gif:
![bug-empty-messages](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14864439/41057010-4a270490-699c-11e8-8e75-73578036801b.gif)

commits.message: display data aggregated by event type

issue.title: Add better endpoints for GUI
issue.body:
The GUI needs specific endpoints that don't send all the voting snapshot through the wire. Instead sends only the data which is actually needed by the GUI.
We can have:
 - **Fetch the voting data for all proposal (only public and "voting-started"):** An alternative endpoints for `activeVotes` which returns all proposals which are active for voting. The only data which is needed from the voting snapshot is the `endheight` so one can tell if the proposal is still on voting or the voting is finished.
- **Fetch the voting data for a single proposal:** An alternative endpoint for `voteResults` which returns the casted votes and the `endheight` from the proposal voting snapshot.

commits.message:
Fix bug with generating a new identity. (#353)

* Fix bug with generating a new identity.

Fixes #351.

* Fix bug found in review.

pull_request.title: Fix bug with generating a new identity.

issue.title: Bug when trying to generate a new identity
issue.body:
When clicking the "Generate new identity" button, it creates a new identity locally and then sends a request to Politeia, which sends an email to the user to verify it. If the user clicks the button again (accidentally or just out of curiosity), it generates a new identity and sends another request to Politeia, but this request fails because the original identity verification email hasn't expired yet. But, the 2nd new identity has already been generated locally, so it's impossible for the user to verify the 1st identity by clicking on the email link.

To fix this issue, I think the UI should revert back to the original identity if the server request fails.

issue.title: Auto-verify new indentity and new user
issue.body:
When the verification token is returned from the server the UI can auto-redirect to the respective verification route to speed up generating new identities. 
For instance, when clicking "Generate new identity" the server will return:
```
{"verificationtoken":"2c68763844920c14719a66914f2d6eed85f39eb173ccd0d2e0b05e1578b05da5"}
```
Then we can redirect to:
`/user/key/verify/?verificationtoken=2c68763844920c14719a66914f2d6eed85f39eb173ccd0d2e0b05e1578b05da5`

The same has to be done for verifying a new user.
This will speed up testing and avoid losing the token sent by the server.

comment.body: You don't need to use local/session storage. I would recommend you creating a module (such as lib/cache_usernames.js) the you can export the variable ‘globalUsernamesById‘ from there and all needed handlers functions. This way we keep all the related code to caching grouped together.

pull_request.title: [WIP] Add usernames to comments.
pull_request.body:
This PR depends on decred/politeia#305.

Closes #348.

comment.body: What do you think if, instead of using the selectors for caching the proposal usernames, use the store subscription  (https://github.com/decred/politeiagui/blob/master/src/App.js#L18) to detect changes on unvetted/vetted response and caching the values there? So we can create a module like `handleCacheUsernamesFromProposals`. It would keep selectors cleaner. It's just an implementation suggestion if you find the current approach is good enough we can tackle the tests for it as well.

issue.title: Empty proposals list message is too generic
issue.body:
Currently it says "There are no proposals yet." This message is too generic; after #177 goes in, we will we have multiple different proposal lists, so it should be tailored specifically to each list.

We should have a unique message for at least the following:

* Public proposals
* Admins' proposals (unreviewed/censored)
* My proposals
* Another user's proposals

issue.title: Add specific messages for empty proposal lists.

Fixes #199.

issue.title: More Identity Mgmt issues
issue.body:
There are a couple issues with Identity Mgmt that need to be resolved:

- Formatting bug for the Key Updated message; missing space between email and other text
- Change Key Updated message to say something else, like "Verification Required" and the message should be orange/yellow instead of green so the user knows further action is required
- Replace the "Action Needed" message when the user imports an identity whose public key matches the server's with a success message
- Add to the identity help text that Politeia stores all past identities
- Add help text for the identity mgmt buttons
- Change "secretKey" to "private" or "privateKey" to be consistent
